title: ECOTOPIA Simulation
description:
THIS PROJECT IS STILL IN PROGRESS

A Multi-agent project using the [GAMA](https://gama-platform.org/) platform.
The project evaluates the realism of the utopian society from the book [Ecotopia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ecotopia) by simulating the effects of implementing its main principles on the country of France.
 The project is done in teams of 11 using the agile method.
I worked mainly on the modelisation of transports.
Done from Nov 2025 to Feb 2026 as part of the [MOSIMA](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/16) course

title: Multi agents Coordination project for exploration and collective tasks
description:
A Multi-agent coordination project using the [JADE](https://jade.tilab.com/) / [DEDALE](https://dedale.gitlab.io/) framework.
The project involves implementing solutions for :
 - distributed exploration and mapping of an unknown environment
 - achieving tasks requiring collaboration between multiple agents
 - handling efficiently deadlocks
 - dealing with adversarial agents that can block paths and move objectives
Done from Jan 2025 to May 2025 as part of the [FoSyMa](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/21) course

title: Satellite Coordination Simulation
description:
THIS PROJECT IS STILL IN PROGRESS

Multi-agent project based on a [variant of the EOSCP](https://arxiv.org/abs/2106.03548) problem.
The project involves scheduling observations on multiple satellites, where each user request has a selection of possible observation windows, some users have exclusive time windows in which they control the satellite's actions.
Done from Nov 2025 to Feb 2026 as part of the [COCOMA](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/15) course

title: Traveling Thief Problem (TTP)
description:
THIS PROJECT IS STILL IN PROGRESS

Creation and comparison of algorithms to solve the [Traveling Thief Problem (TTP)](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/260249991_The_travelling_thief_problem_The_first_step_in_the_transition_from_theoretical_problems_to_realistic_problems), as well as the Cumulative TSP with knapsack constraint (KCTSP).
Done from Nov 2025 to Feb 2026 as part of the [MAOA](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/27) course

title: Active Perception with VLM
description:
A project on active perception using vision-language models (VLMs) to improve perception and classification tasks in robotics.
Done at the Institute of Intelligent Systems and Robotics ([ISIR](https://www.isir.upmc.fr/)).
Done from Jan 2025 to May 2025 as part of the [Projet AI2D](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/718) course : [Project description](https://ai2d.hosted.lip6.fr/node/742)

title: ARMageddon
description:
THIS PROJECT IS STILL IN PROGRESS

A serious game to learn the Semaphore alphabet (hand positions) using the webcam, the gameplay is based on the game 'Alphattack' where the player has to defend against incoming missiles by correctly signaling the letters using the Semaphore alphabet.
The focus of the course is on the adaptation of the game to the way the player plays (we use Bayesian Knowledge Tracing to model the player's knowledge of the alphabet and adapt the game accordingly).
Done from Nov 2025 to Feb 2026 as part of the [AI-Adapt](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/12) course

title: AI detection chrome extension
description:
THIS PROJECT IS STILL IN PROGRESS

A Chrome extension that runs a local LLM (via Ollama) to detect whether a given text is likely AI generated or Human along a screenshot of the context.
The focus of the course this project is for is to explore the Human-AI interaction.
Done from Nov 2025 to Feb 2026 as part of the [HAII](https://androide.lip6.fr/node/26) course

title: Mobile App : Skyjo Tracker
description:
A mobile app for Android to track games for the card game [Skyjo](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skyjo).
The app is written in Java using [Android Studio](https://developer.android.com/studio)
 the app includes features such as :
 - tracking games in real time by logging the player actions
 - tracking statistics for each player over sessions
 - saving games and sessions for statistics
Done from Jul 2024 to Aug 2024 for tracking games with friends and family

title: Labyrinth (Ravensburger board game) competition in C
Position estimation using ArUco tags
description: Participation at the Robotech association in Polytech Sorbonne for attempting the French Robotic Cup
